Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: தீயள வன்றித் தெரியான் பெரிதுண்ணின் நோயள வின்றிப் படும்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: He will be afflicted with numberless diseases, who eats immoderately, ignorant (of the rules of health).

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A person is shown eating a massive, excessive meal ('பெரிதுண்ணின்'). They are ignorant of the 'fire of digestion' within them ('தீயளவு தெரியான்').
Layered_Composition.Midground: Their digestive fire, visualized as a small, struggling flame in their stomach, is being overwhelmed and extinguished by the sheer volume of food.
Layered_Composition.Background: Because their digestive fire is put out, the undigested food is shown to be breeding a countless horde of monstrous, small diseases ('நோயளவின்றி'). These disease-creatures are swarming out and attacking the person's body from within.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: The one who eats excessively, without considering the capacity of their digestive fire, will suffer from innumerable diseases.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The digestive fire being extinguished by the food is a key visual. The countless disease-monsters being born from the undigested food is a powerful metaphor for the consequences.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: A sickly, gluttonous light. The disease-monsters are grotesque and have unpleasant colors. The small digestive fire is a pathetic, dying light.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A surreal, cross-section view of the person's body, showing the entire disastrous internal process.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, with a dark, grotesque, and fantastical aesthetic.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: The primary light source is the sickly food and the swarming diseases.

Cultural_Anchors: Ignorant of the digestive fire's measure ('தீயளவு தெரியான்')
